UNEDUCATED.Definition: having received little or no education

ARROGANT.Definition: unpleasantly proud and behaving as if you are more important than, or know more than, other people

REVOLVES AROUND.Definition: to have something as a very important part or purpose

HARBOR.Definition: to think about or feel something, usually over a long period

DISDAIN.Definition: the feeling of not liking someone or something and thinking that he, she, or it does not deserve your interest or respect

RESENTMENT.Definition: a feeling of anger because you have been forced to accept something that you do not like

MISCONCEPTION.Definition: an idea that is wrong because it has been based on a failure to understand a situation

CONDESCENDING.Definition: treating someone as if you are more important or more intelligent than them

PIECE OF SHIT.Definition: something of little value or poor quality

ASSHOLE.Definition: a stupid, annoying, or detestable person

CLICKBAIT.Definition: something (such as a headline) designed to make readers want to click on a hyperlink especially when the link leads to content of dubious value or interest

OFFENDED.Definition: upset and angry, often because someone has been rude

CONDONE.Definition: to accept or allow behavior that is wrong

NOT GIVE A SINGLE FUCK.Definition: to not care at all about someone or something â€”used in negative statement

INFERIOR.Definition: not good, or not as good as someone or something else

EXPOSED.Definition: to submit or make accessible to a particular action or influence

FOR THE SAKE OF SIMPLICITY.Definition: in order to make something simpler and easier

EXPOSURE.Definition: the fact of experiencing something or being affected by it because of being in a particular situation or place

COMMERCIALS.Definition: an advertisement that is broadcast on television or radio

STARVING.Definition: very hungry; dying because of not having enough food

CULTURES.Definition: the way of life, especially the general customs and beliefs, of a particular group of people at a particular time

DIVERSE.Definition: including many different types of people or things

ETHNICALLY.Definition: in a way that relates to someone's ethnicity (= the fact of belonging to a large group of people with a shared culture, language, history, set of traditions, etc.

DIVIDED.Definition: split into two or more opposing groups who cannot agree

GENERALIZE.Definition: to make a general statement that something is true in all cases, based on what is true in some cases

HANG OUT.Definition: to spend a lot of time in a place or with someone

IDENTIFY.Definition: to feel and say that you belong to a particular group of people

HUMAN NATURE.Definition: the natural ways of behaving that most people share

SEGREGATION.Definition: to keep one group of people apart from others because of race, religion, sex, etc.

EXACERBATED.Definition: to make something that is already bad even worse

BARRIERS.Definition: anything that prevents people from being together or understanding each other

STICK WITH.Definition: to stay close to someone, or to continue to do something

NEIGHBORHOOD.Definition: the area of a town that surrounds someone's home, or the people who live in this area

MULTICULTURAL.Definition: including people who have many different customs and beliefs

ENEMY.Definition: a person who hates or opposes another person and tries to harm them or stop them from doing something

MOTIVATED.Definition: very enthusiastic or determined because you really want to do something

LENS.Definition: something that facilitates and influences perception, comprehension, or evaluation

INTERPRET.Definition: to decide what the intended meaning of something is

REINFORCING.Definition: if something reinforces an idea or opinion, it provides more proof or support for it and makes it seem true

IGNORANT.Definition: not having enough knowledge, understanding, or information about something

UNGRATEFUL.Definition: not showing or expressing any thanks

RACIST.Definition: someone who believes that their race makes them better, more intelligent, more moral, etc. than people of other races and who does or says unfair or harmful things as a result

ENCOURAGED.Definition: to make someone more likely to do something, or to make something more likely to happen

THANK MY LUCKY STARS.Definition: to be very grateful for something

DEFEND.Definition: to protect someone or something against attack or criticism

CONSUMING.Definition: to enjoy avidly; to utilize or engage fully

MAINSTREAM.Definition: mainstream organizations, ideas, etc. are those that are considered normal, and accepted or used by most people

ALLEGIANCE.Definition: loyalty and support for a ruler, country, group, or belief

CAPTIVITY.Definition: the situation in which a person or animal is kept somewhere and is not allowed to leave

MAKE SENSE.Definition: to be clear and easy to understand

INDICATION.Definition: a sign that something exists, is true, or is likely to happen

EXPLORE.Definition: to try to discover; learn about

NATURALLY.Definition: as you would expect; in a usual or easy way

AWKWARD.Definition: in a way that is not natural, relaxed, or attractive

IRONIC.Definition: interesting, strange, or funny because of being very different from what you would usually expect

PUT THINGS IN PERSPECTIVE.Definition: to clarify, appraise, or assess the true value, importance, or significance of something

IRRATIONAL.Definition: not using reason or clear thinking

REMEDY.Definition: a way of dealing with a difficult situation or solving a problem

CHILDISH.Definition: marked by or suggestive of immaturity and lack of poise

COUNTERPRODUCTIVE.Definition: having an effect that is opposite to the one intended or wanted

RIDICULOUS.Definition: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at

OPPOSING.Definition: competing or fighting against each other

ALTERNATIVE.Definition: considered to be unusual and often have a small but enthusiastic group of people who support them

CRITICIZE.Definition: to express disapproval of someone or something

EMBARRASS.Definition: to cause someone to feel nervous, worried, or uncomfortable

CANCEL.Definition: to completely reject and stop supporting someone, especially because they have said something that offends you

HUMILITY.Definition: the feeling or attitude that you have no special importance that makes you better than others; lack of pride

CURIOSITY.Definition: an eager wish to know or learn about something
